item.title: Ark Encounter UPDATE! Quick rundown on what to prepare for! [CrossPolitic Show]
item.description:
Dear Fight Laugh Feast Conference Attendees!

 

We are so excited to see you at the Politics of Six Day Creation Conference next week! We are looking forward to fellowshipping with old friends, meeting new friends, and hearing from some great speakers. As you get ready for your trip to the conference, here are some important details to keep in mind, so please do read to the end!

 

  • Conference kick off: Veteran Fight Laugh Feast Conference goers will know that the conference normally kicks off with Beer and Psalms immediately following registration. This year, you will not register before Beer and Psalms. Beer and Psalms is also not on Ark Encounter property. The Beer and Psalms event is happening on Wednesday, October 11th from 6:30-9:00 PM at the Grant County Fairgrounds: 115 Baton Rouge Drive, Williamstown, KY 41097 (15 minute drive from the Ark). Heavy hors d'oeuvres, beer and wine, snacks for the kiddos, and a bouncy house will be provided as well as hearty fellowship and singing! We do recommend eating a light dinner before coming. This is an outdoor fairground venue, so we also recommend that you wear shoes you don’t mind getting a little dirty and bringing a jacket. When you arrive at Beer and Psalms, volunteers will help direct you on where to park.  

 

Registration for the conference will happen the following day, Thursday, October 12th starting at 5:00 PM in the Answers Center adjacent to the Ark. We’ll then officially kick the conference off with our first talk by Toby Sumpter at 7PM. There will be an After Party to follow at the View Event Center: 900 KY-36 W, Williamstown, KY 41097 (2 minute drive from the Ark). There will be pizza and beer/wine available for purchase, and fire pits to make s’mores for dessert! The first round of drinks will be provided by one of our sponsors! 

 

  • Arriving at the Ark: The Ark’s address is: 1 Ark Encounter Drive - Williamstown, KY 41097. When you arrive at the Ark Encounter for the conference, you will park, take a shuttle to the Ark Encounter Grounds, and then go through Ark Encounter admissions. Ark Encounter admissions is where you will present the 3-Day Bouncer Pass that is required for all FLF conference attendees. Please note that the Ark parking fees are $15 for standard size vehicles and $20 for oversized vehicles. We recommend arriving a little early each day of the conference as well as bringing anything with you that you may need throughout the day due to the shuttle process. Please keep in mind that the Ark does not permit concealed carried guns and there is a security process when going through their admissions. 

 

  • The Creation Museum: Please be aware that the Creation Museum is not on the Ark Encounter grounds. It is located in Petersburg, KY (about a 45 minute drive from the Ark Encounter). If you’d like to visit the museum, please plan your trip accordingly. We recommend going to visit the museum the morning of Thursday, October 12th before conference registration opens that evening. 

 

To see the full schedule for the weekend, speakers, psalm sheet, and more, head to our website! Attached is a map of the Ark Encounter grounds, so you can familiarize yourself with where you will be during the conference. Again, we are looking forward to seeing you soon! If you have any questions about the conference, please reach out to us at contact@fightlaughfeast.com. 

 

Blessings,

 

The Fight Laugh Feast Network

item.title: Is Genesis History? Mountains After the Flood - Dr. John Whitmore & Thomas Purifoy on CrossPolitic [CrossPolitic Show]
item.description:
Thomas Purifoy is a creative filmmaker who develops video-based learning resources to advance the Kingdom of God. Oversees three companies: Compass Cinema, Compass Classroom, Compass Creative. Thomas produced, wrote, and directed the feature documentary "Is Genesis History?" He is currently producing the sequel.

 

Dr. John Whitmore taught high school science and math and spent a summer working for the United States Geological Survey. Dr. Whitmore serves on the board of the Creation Geology Society and is a member of the Creation Research Society and the Geological Society of America (GSA).

item.title: Battling Witchcraft & Death Threats with The Gospel - Serving the Lord in Uganda w/ Sam Kisembo [CrossPolitic Show]
item.description:
Support Sam Kisembo's Ministry

https://www.givesendgo.com/Kisembo 

 

Sam Kisembo is an evangelist & church planter – particularly in hostile regions of Uganda rampant with witchcraft. He pastors and trains pastors in the community of Mutungo, near Lake Victoria. His church oversees a Christian school and orphanage in their village that has seen a massive influx of children due to economic strains and starvation. He is a minister of over 30 years and is engaged on the national level in his country as a church leader & influential public voice.

item.title: Taking Back the Culture by Preaching the Kingdom w/ Roger Dunlop [CrossPolitic Show]
item.description:
Roger Dunlop is an Anatomy Demonstrator and Clinical Tutor at Queen's University Belfast, and author of the new book Taking Back the Culture by Preaching the Kingdom.

 

Oklahoma Hymn Sing:

The Cumings family is hosting a hymn sing Sunday, October 1, from 5-8pm. Join them if you are passionate about worshiping God in music or just want to sing traditional hymns in an informal setting.  Email Christopher at christopherandmary@gmail.com for their address west of Tulsa, Oklahoma. They have a few extra 1961 Trinity hymnals, so if you have some hymnals, bring them. Mary will have a baked potato bar, dessert, and coffee. You are not required to bring food, but you may bring potato toppings or dessert if you would like to do so. Bring lawn chairs in case we run out of room inside. Again, email christopherandmary@gmail.com for their address for the hymn sing happening October 1st - from 5-8pm.
